title: Authors and Citation
text: Vihtakari M, Elvarsson B, Butler W, Lentin J (2024). gadgetplots: Plot gadget3 models. R package version 0.3.0, https://gadget-framework.github.io/gadgetplots/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {gadgetplots: Plot gadget3 models},   author = {Mikko Vihtakari and Bjarki Thor Elvarsson and Will Butler and Jamie Lentin},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.3.0},   url = {https://gadget-framework.github.io/gadgetplots/}, }

title: Plot gadget3 models
text: Plot gadget3 model output using ggplot2. R package version 0.3.0 gadgetplots package produces diagnostics graphics gadget3 using ggplot2. package replaces plotting capabilities Rgadget package designed work gadget2.

title: Plot gadget3 models
text: gadgetplots available CRAN yet. Use devtools remotes packages install directly GitHub:
code: # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("gadget-framework/gadgetplots")

title: Plot gadget3 models
text: See function reference detailed list functions documentation use . make_html() function generates single html file gadgetutils::g3_fit() output contains key model diagnostics. , package produces plots four categories: plot_*() functions plot gadget model output generated using gadgetutils::g3_fit(). functions generic shorthand, plot(), param argument specifying type plot. dplot_*() functions plot gadget model input data generated using mfdb, gadgetutils::g3_data() gadgetutils::add_g3_attributes() functions. g3d_plot() function plots data directly gadget model object. g3plot_* functions plot gadget suitability (selectivity) functions.

what: Found a bug or desire a feature?
title: Plot gadget3 models
text: package active development together gadget3 framework. Please report bugs write feature requests Issues.

title: Plot age distribution data for a gadget3 model — dplot_adist
text: x gadget3 ready data frame created using mfdb, g3_data add_g3_attributes. type Character specifying plot type: "bar" "ggridges". color_palette function defining color palette used fill bars. scales Character defining facet_wrap scales argument use. ncol Number columns passed facet_wrap base_size Base size parameter ggplot. See ggtheme.

See scale_color_manual. adjust color facet_age = FALSE, use standard ggplot2::scale_fill_* functions. base_size Base size parameter ggplot. See ggtheme.

title: Plot stock distribution data for a gadget3 model — dplot_stockdist
text: x gadget3 ready data frame created using mfdb, g3_data add_g3_attributes. stock_col Character defining name column separating stocks. proportion Logical indicating whether plot proportion stocks instead absolute numbers. group_by_sex Logical indicating whether take proportions sex (TRUE) stocks (FALSE). Used proportion = TRUE sexes Named vector length two containing regular expressions separating sexes stock_col. See default example. colors vector colors used stocks. NULL, scales::hue_pal() used scales Character defining facet_wrap scales argument use. base_size Base size parameter ggplot. See ggtheme.

text: ggplot object.

title: Plot of data passed into a gadget model — g3d_plot
text: model R TMB model. model object g3_to_r g3_to_tmb functions. regexp Either NULL (filtering) character string giving regular expression filter model-data components. Useful alternatives: "adist" abundance distribution data, "cdist" catch distribution data, "surveyindices" survey indices, "catch" catches. scales Character defining facet_wrap scales argument use. ncol Number columns passed  facet_wrap base_size Base size parameter ggplot. See ggtheme.

code: g3plot_andersen(   length,   p0,   p1,   p2,   p3,   p4,   p5,   add = FALSE,   base_size = 8,   ... )

title: Plot Andersen suitability using model parameters — g3plot_andersen
text: length Numeric vector defining lengths suitabilities plotted p0, p1, p2, p3, p4, p5 (Named) numeric vectors defining Andersen suitability function parameters. See suitability. length > 1, multiple curves plotted using different line type. parameters must length. add Logical indicating whether function produce ggplot2 layer can added existing ggplot (TRUE) whether plot results (FALSE) base_size Base size parameter ggplot. See ggtheme. ... Additional arguments passed plot_* functions.

title: Plot Andersen suitability using model parameters — g3plot_andersen

what: Plot exponentiall50 suitability using model parameters — g3plot_exponentiall50
title: Plot exponentiall50 suitability using model parameters — g3plot_exponentiall50
text: Plot exponentiall50 suitability using model parameters

title: Plot exponentiall50 suitability using model parameters — g3plot_exponentiall50
code: g3plot_exponentiall50(length, alpha, l50, add = FALSE, base_size = 8, ...)

title: Plot exponentiall50 suitability using model parameters — g3plot_exponentiall50
text: length Numeric vector defining lengths suitabilities plotted alpha (Named) numeric vector defining exponentiall50 slopes. length > 1, multiple curves plotted using different line type. See suitability. l50 Numeric vector defining exponentiall50 l50 values. Must length alpha add Logical indicating whether function produce ggplot2 layer can added existing ggplot (TRUE) whether plot results (FALSE) base_size Base size parameter ggplot. See ggtheme. ... Additional arguments passed geom_line

title: Plot exponentiall50 suitability using model parameters — g3plot_exponentiall50
code: data(fit) suit <- fit$params[grepl("ghl_female.ecos.survey", fit$params$switch),]  g3plot_exponentiall50(    length = 1:60,    alpha = unlist(suit[grepl("alpha", suit$switch), "value"]),    l50 = unlist(suit[grepl("l50", suit$switch), "value"])    )

what: Wrapper for plot.gadget.fit that saves all diagnostic graphs to a directory — gadget_plots
title: Wrapper for plot.gadget.fit that saves all diagnostic graphs to a directory — gadget_plots
text: Wrapper plot.gadget.fit saves diagnostic graphs directory

title: Wrapper for plot.gadget.fit that saves all diagnostic graphs to a directory — gadget_plots
code: gadget_plots(   fit,   path,   file_type = "png",   quiet = FALSE,   width = NULL,   height = NULL,   units = "cm",   res = 300,   ... )

title: Wrapper for plot.gadget.fit that saves all diagnostic graphs to a directory — gadget_plots
text: fit gadget fit object. See g3_fit. path Directory path saving figures. file_type Character. Either one devices ggsave, case files defined type printed path, "html" compiles plots one html file using knit make_html function. quiet Logical indicating whether print messages plotting process. Set FALSE suppress messages. width, height Plot size given units. NULL, reasonable standard values used. units Units plot size. See ggsave res Plot resolution. See dpi argument ggsave ... Additional arguments plotting functions (used plot_annual moment)

title: Wrapper for plot.gadget.fit that saves all diagnostic graphs to a directory — gadget_plots
text: Returns nothing, makes requested files.

what: Save diagnostic graphs to a single html document — make_html
title: Save diagnostic graphs to a single html document — make_html
text: Save diagnostic graphs single html document

title: Save diagnostic graphs to a single html document — make_html
code: make_html(   fit,   path,   harvest_rate = TRUE,   file_name = "model_output_figures.html",   template = "standard" )

title: Save diagnostic graphs to a single html document — make_html
text: fit gadget fit object. See g3_fit. path Directory path saving html output. harvest_rate Logical value, TRUE harvest rate plotted, FALSE fishing mortality plotted. file_name Character specifying name html file without path. Must include file extension. template Character specifying html template use. See details.

title: Save diagnostic graphs to a single html document — make_html
text: Returns nothing, makes requested file. See webpage example output.

title: Save diagnostic graphs to a single html document — make_html
text: package contains html templates tailored different stocks needed authors. Specify name template argument. Current alternatives : standard Standard model output figures. Use harvest_rate argument switch F HR figures. iceland Output tailored Icelandic stock assessment. nea_ghl Output tailored Northeast Arctic Greenland halibut assessment.

title: Plot gadget.fit object — plot.gadget.fit
text: wrapper function plot results gadget.fit object.

title: Plot gadget.fit object — plot.gadget.fit
code: # S3 method for gadget.fit plot(x, param = "annual", ...)

title: Plot gadget.fit object — plot.gadget.fit
text: x gadget fit object. See g3_fit. param Character defining parameter plot. See Details. ... Additional parameters passed separate plotting functions.

title: Plot gadget.fit object — plot.gadget.fit
text: Single list ggplot objects depending arguments.

title: Plot gadget.fit object — plot.gadget.fit
text: wrapper plot results gadget.fit object. function produces different plots defined param argument additional arguments passed respective functions. Valid param options : annual Annual summary central model data. Uses plot_annual biomass Stock biomass. Uses plot_biomass total Stock biomass total. Uses plot_biomass(..., total = TRUE) abundance Stock abundance. Uses plot_biomass(..., biomass = FALSE) ssb Spawning stock biomass. Uses plot_ssb rec Recruitment. Uses plot_rec f Fishing mortality. Uses plot_f catch Catches stock. Uses plot_catch(..., type = "stock") catch Catches fleet. Uses plot_catch(..., type = "fleet") hr Harvest rate. Uses plot_catch(..., type = "hr") si Survey indices. Uses plot_si catchdist Catch distribution comparison data. Uses plot_catchdist stockdist Stock distribution comparison data. Uses plot_stockdist stockcomp Model stock composition. Uses plot_stockcomp suitablity Suitability (fleet selection). Uses plot_suitability growth Average length age. Uses plot_growth agelength Age-length (growth parameter) fit. Uses plot_agelength agecomp Age composition. Uses plot_agecomp resid Residuals. Uses plot_resid likelihood Likelihood scores. Uses plot_likelihood weighted Weighted likelihood scores. Uses plot_likelihood(..., type = "weighted") pie Proportion summed weighted likelihood scores. Uses plot_likelihood(..., type = "pie") weight Parameter component weights params Parameter values relative boundaries

title: Plot of age composition from the model — plot_agecomp
text: fit gadget fit object. See g3_fit. type Character specifying plot type. Options: "bar", "line", "ggridges" "bubble". See Details. scales Character defining facet_wrap scales argument use. biomass Logical indicating whether biomass plotted instead abundance. base_size Base size parameter ggplot. See ggtheme. return_data Logical indicating whether return data plot instead plot .

title: Plot of age composition from the model — plot_agecomp
text: ggplot object.

title: Plot of age composition from the model — plot_agecomp
text: Possible plot types : bar Facetted bar plot year x-axis, abundance y-axis ages along rows. Year classes colored. line Facetted line plot year x-axis, abundance y-axis ages along rows. Stocks colored. ggridges bars overlapping. bubble (string) Bubble plot year x-axis, age y-axis point size scaled abundance. Year classes colored. Note "bar" "bubble" contain extra information text plotly::ggplotly.

title: Plot of age composition from the model — plot_agecomp
code: data(fit) plot_agecomp(fit) #> Warning: Removed 41 rows containing missing values (`geom_point()`).  plot_agecomp(fit, type = "line", biomass = TRUE)  plot_agecomp(fit, type = "bar")  plot_agecomp(fit, type = "ggridges")

title: Plot stock biomasses — plot_biomass
text: Plot stock biomasses

title: Plot stock biomasses — plot_biomass
code: plot_biomass(   fit,   type = "line",   total = FALSE,   biomass = TRUE,   stocks = NULL,   min_catch_length = NULL,   return_data = FALSE,   base_size = 8 )

title: Plot stock biomasses — plot_biomass
text: fit gadget fit object. See g3_fit. type Character specifying plot type. Options: "line" "area". See examples. total Logical indicating whether total biomass plotted. effect type = "area". biomass Logical indicating whether biomass plotted instead abundance. stocks Character specifying substock plot fit. NULL, stocks plotted. applicable min_catch_length defined. min_catch_length Numeric value defining minimum catch length (size), used filter (>=) model population calculating biomass. Combines stocks. Turn setting NULL (default). return_data Logical indicating whether return data plot instead plot . base_size Base size parameter ggplot. See ggtheme.

title: Plot stock biomasses — plot_biomass
text: ggplot object.

title: Plot stock biomasses — plot_biomass
code: data(fit) plot_biomass(fit)  plot_biomass(fit, biomass = FALSE, total = TRUE)  plot_biomass(fit, type = "area")  plot_biomass(fit, min_catch_length = 45)

title: Plot catches — plot_catch
text: fit gadget fit object. See g3_fit. type Character specifying data type: "stock" plots catches stock, "fleet" fleet, "total" catches without separating stock fleet, "hr" harvest rates fleet. biomass Logical indicating whether biomass plotted instead estimated abundance. base_size Base size parameter ggplot. See ggtheme. return_data Logical indicating whether return data plot instead plot .

title: Plot catches — plot_catch
text: ggplot object.

title: Plot catches — plot_catch
code: data(fit) plot_catch(fit)  plot_catch(fit, biomass = FALSE)  plot_catch(fit, type = "total")  plot_catch(fit, type = "fleet")  plot_catch(fit, type = "hr")

title: Plot harvest rate — plot_hr
text: Plot harvest rate

title: Plot harvest rate — plot_hr
code: plot_hr(   fit,   stocks = NULL,   min_catch_length = NULL,   biomass = TRUE,   model_selectivity = TRUE,   base_size = 8,   return_data = FALSE )

title: Plot harvest rate — plot_hr
text: fit gadget fit object. See g3_fit. stocks Character specifying substock plot fit. NULL, stocks plotted. applicable min_catch_length defined. min_catch_length Numeric value defining minimum catch length (size), used filter (>=) model population calculating harvest rates using catches. Combines stocks. Turn setting NULL (default). Set 0 get HR entire model population. See Details. biomass Logical indicating whether biomass used calculate harvest rates instead abundance. model_selectivity Logical indicating whether use model selectivity calculating harvest rates. FALSE calculate harvest rate using entire population, TRUE using harvestable biomass following fleet suitabilities. applicable using stocks parameter min_catch_length = 0. base_size Base size parameter ggplot. See ggtheme. return_data Logical indicating whether return data plot instead plot .

title: Plot harvest rate — plot_hr
text: ggplot object.

title: Plot harvest rate — plot_hr
text: function uses catches without filtering size (allocates substocks) varies denominator depending min_catch_length argument. min_catch_length = NULL, output represents harvest rate substock assuming model fleet selectivities (fetched harv.biomass column fit$res..year). min_catch_length = 0, output represents harvest rate entire model population assuming model fleet selectivities (fetched harv.biomass column fit$res..year, stocks summed calculating harvest rate). Finally, min_catch_length number > 0, output represents harvest rate assuming flat selectivity lengths >= min_catch_length. Note last real model harvest rate. used reporting results, never finding target harvest rates projections, instance. min_catch_length = 0 latter case.

title: Plot harvest rate — plot_hr
code: data(fit) plot_hr(fit)  plot_hr(fit, model_selectivity = FALSE)  plot_hr(fit, min_catch_length = 45)

title: Plot model biomass from a retrospective analysis — plot_retro
text: retro_fit list g3_fit objects differ terminal year, .e. result retrospective analysis. first object years removed objects sorted chronologically increasing number years removed. var Character argument defining variable plot. "total.biomass" "hr" currently implemented. by_stock Logical indicating whether produce plots stock addition total biomass. min_catch_length Numeric value defining minimum catch length (size), used filter (>=) model population calculating harvest rates using catches. Combines stocks. Turn setting NULL (default). Set 0 get HR entire model population. See Details. base_size Base size parameter ggplot. See ggtheme. ncol Number columns used plot.

title: Plot survey indices — plot_si
text: Plot survey indices

title: Plot survey indices — plot_si
code: plot_si(fit, type = "model_fit", base_size = 8)

title: Plot survey indices — plot_si
text: fit gadget fit object. See g3_fit. type Character specifying plot type: "model_fit" plots model fit survey index data year, "regression" plots regression lines together logarithms model biomass/abundance observed index values, "scatter" produces scatter plot predicted observed index using values "model_fit". See details. base_size Base size parameter ggplot. See ggtheme.

title: Plot survey indices — plot_si
text: ggplot object.

title: Plot survey indices — plot_si
text: Relationship survey index () model biomass abundance (B) defined length range expressed \(= e^B^b\), \(e^\) catchability (also called q) b stock size dependent catchability (see type = "model_fit"). Whether compared model biomass abundance, depends units (.e. column name data object; "number" -> abundance, "weight" -> biomass). survey index called "observed" figure, "predicted" derived \(exp(+ b \; log(B))\). b can visualized using log-linear formula \(log() = + b \;  log(B)\) (see type = "regression"; log-linear regressions shown using blue lines). coefficient determination \(R^2\) calculated using regression. compare observed predicted values model fit plot, use type = "scatter". grey line represents diagonal line slope 1 intercept 0 (.e. \(= B\), \(= 0\), \(b = 1\)).

title: Plot survey indices — plot_si
code: data(fit) plot_si(fit)  plot_si(fit, type = "regression")  plot_si(fit, type = "scatter")

title: Plot stock distribution — plot_stockdist
text: fit gadget fit object. See g3_fit. stocks Character vector specifying stock plot fit. NULL, stocks plotted single plot. "separate", stocks plotted separate plots. name Character vector specifying likelihood component plot unique(fit$stockdist$name). NULL, components plotted list. type Character specifying plot type: "step" uses stepwise lines show aggregation intervals. "line" uses lines average values lower upper intervals. want show aggregation intervals use average values (.e. smooth lines), use show_intervals argument. show_intervals Logical indicating whether length intervals plotted. color_palette function defining color palette vector colors used stocks. base_size Base size parameter ggplot. See ggtheme.

title: Plot stock distribution — plot_stockdist
text: ggplot object list objects depending stocks argument.

title: Plot stock distribution — plot_stockdist
text: Plots model fit data using likelihoods. Separate plot unique(fit$stockdist$name).

title: Plot stock distribution — plot_stockdist
code: data(fit) # Only one dataset to save space: plot_stockdist(fit, name = "EggaN_matp") #> $EggaN_matp #> Warning: Removed 12 rows containing missing values (`geom_step()`).  #>  plot_stockdist(fit, name = "EggaN_matp", stocks = "separate",                color_palette = NULL) #> Warning: Removed 12 rows containing missing values (`geom_step()`). #> $EggaN_matp  #>  plot_stockdist(fit, name = "EggaN_matp", type = "line", show_intervals = TRUE) #> $EggaN_matp #> Warning: Removed 10 rows containing missing values (`geom_line()`).  #>
